gov.sandia.cf.dao.migration

Class EclipseLinkMigrationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.cf.dao.migration.EclipseLinkMigrationManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDBMigrationManager

    public class EclipseLinkMigrationManager
extends Object
implements IDBMigrationManager
    SQL Database version migration class. This class is used to launch version migration change scripts before loading the database schema. It is specific to EclipseLink and must be re-implemented if the ORM changes.
    Author:
    Didier Verstraete

      • executeMigration

        public void executeMigration()
                      throws CredibilityException,
                             org.hsqldb.cmdline.SqlToolError,
                             SQLException,
                             IOException,
                             URISyntaxException,
                             CredibilityMigrationException
        Description copied from interface: IDBMigrationManager
        Process the database migration
        Specified by:
        executeMigration in interface IDBMigrationManager
        Throws:
        CredibilityException - if a parameter is not valid.
        org.hsqldb.cmdline.SqlToolError - if a sql tool error occurs.
        SQLException - if a sql exception occurs.
        IOException - if a file read exception occurs.
        URISyntaxException - if a file path is not valid.
        CredibilityMigrationException - if a migration error occurs.

      • getTasksToExecute

        public SortedMap<Integer,IMigrationTask> getTasksToExecute(org.eclipse.persistence.sessions.UnitOfWork unitOfWork)
                                                    throws URISyntaxException,
                                                           IOException,
                                                           CredibilityMigrationException
        Parameters:
        unitOfWork - used to execute sql queries
        Returns:
        the sql scripts list to execute on the current database version. This method get the current version from VERSION column in the MODEL table and compare it with the name of the scripts listed into the SCRIPT_FOLDER_PATH.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occured while reading script.
        URISyntaxException - if the script path is not valid.
        CredibilityMigrationException - if one task is not valid

      • isValidScript

        public boolean isValidScript(IMigrationTask task,
                             org.eclipse.persistence.sessions.UnitOfWork unitOfWork)
                      throws CredibilityMigrationException
        Parameters:
        task - the migration task to execute
        unitOfWork - to execute sql queries
        Returns:
        true if the current script can be executed and has not been executed on the current database, or has been executed but is in error, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        CredibilityMigrationException - if the task is not valid

        public static boolean existsTable(org.eclipse.persistence.sessions.UnitOfWork unitOfWork,

        Parameters:

        table - the database table
        Returns:

                                    org.hsqldb.cmdline.SqlToolError,
                                    URISyntaxException
        Execute the script in parameter.
        Parameters:
        unitOfWork - used to execute sql queries
        script - the sql script to execute
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a sql exception occurs
        IOException - if a file read exception occurs
        org.hsqldb.cmdline.SqlToolError - if a sql tool error occurs

      • splitSqlQueries

        public List<String> splitSqlQueries(Path scriptPath)
                             throws IOException
        Parameters:
        scriptPath - the script to parse and split
        Returns:
        the sql queries contained in the script file. This method reads all the lines from the script and parse it to delete the comments and transform it to a list of executable sql queries.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occured while reading script.

      • sqlVariableQuote

        public String sqlVariableQuote(String variable)
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable to parse
        Returns:
        the sql variable with sql quotes escaped.
